title: Amazon KDP High-Content Keyword Research (My Proven Method)

tactics.name: Single Keyword Focus
tactics.description: Identify one high-demand keyword with minimal competition by analyzing Amazon's page one search results and filtering out irrelevant variations.
steps: Find a keyword with strong search volume
Validate by checking page one search results
caveats: Avoid niches with excessive dead books
source_quotes: we want to focus on one place to actually accurately predict the keyword's validity

tactics.name: Avoid Blob Effect
tactics.description: Steer clear of oversaturated keywords where many similar books compete, leading to poor visibility.
steps: Identify low-review books with high BSR
Avoid authority figures and dead books
caveats: Does not account for cover quality or niche specificity
source_quotes: if you publish in these topics your books just going to get slapped right here

tactics.name: Demand Outnumbers Supply
tactics.description: Target keywords where customer demand exceeds book supply, ensuring easier ranking.
steps: Ensure low competition and low BSR
source_quotes: the demand outnumbers to supply there are more customers than there are books to supply them

tactics.name: Deep Sea Keyword Targeting
tactics.description: Focus on niche topics with low competition and high demand by analyzing BSR rankings and review counts
steps: Use Book Beam to check BSR history
Validate topic consistency across top books
caveats: May fail if topic is too broad or saturated
source_quotes: if you find this type of keyword where there's only a handful of relevant books but all those relevant books are actually doing well then you found the gold

tactics.name: Surface Level Avoidance
tactics.description: Avoid oversaturated niches with many existing books
steps: Filter out keywords with excessive competition
caveats: Hard to stand out with ads in these niches
source_quotes: 99% of new Publishers are going to stay here and publish books here

tactics.name: Deep Keyword Validation
tactics.description: Identify low-competition, high-demand keywords with limited winning books and low review counts.
steps: Adjust metrics to focus on deep search keywords
Filter for topics with few winning books and low BSR
Check for subgenres with untapped traffic
caveats: Avoid overly niche keywords with no search volume
source_quotes: you want the demand to outpace the supply

heuristics.name: Low Review Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: there's less than 100 reviews on them and they have a BSR of less than 50,000

heuristics.name: Low Review Filter
source_quotes: low reviewed books with high bsrs but they forget that the keyboard also has 10 authority figures

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: if these books don't have a lot of reviews and maybe it might just be an anomaly

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Rule
source_quotes: you can almost validate pretty much 90% of them but they're hard to actually succeed in

claims.statement: A single high-quality keyword can generate thousands of dollars in sales
source_quotes: one strong keyboard in search term can generate thousands of dollars

claims.statement: High BSR books with low reviews are trapped in the blob effect, reducing visibility.
source_quotes: if you publish in these topics your books just going to get slapped right here

claims.statement: Niche keywords with few relevant books have higher ranking potential
source_quotes: the chances of us ranking on this first page is extremely high

claims.statement: Surface level keywords have high competition and poor success rates due to oversaturation.
source_quotes: people find these surface level keywords where on paper... and they wonder why they don't have success

niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience segments with unique constraints to reduce competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Limits competition while maintaining search relevance
source_quotes: if we can't make money from one keyword why do we expect to make money ranking for 100 of them
